definition: to do/to make/to go in for/to set up/to get hold of/to take care of
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations

sentences.english: There is too much monkey business going on in the governor's office.
sentences.chinese: 州长办公室搞鬼搞得太厉害了。

sentences.english: Do you think the professor will grade on the curve?
sentences.chinese: 你认为教授会在评分中搞鬼吗？

sentences.english: This man always plays tricks in secret.

sentences.chinese: 坦率地说，我认为你在搞鬼。

sentences.english: Those men are behaving very suspiciously. They're engaged in some fishy business. I'll be bound.
sentences.chinese: 那些人行为非常可疑，我敢肯定他们在搞鬼。

sentences.english: Keep an eye on those businessmen, they are up to no good.
sentences.chinese: 注意看著那些商人，他们会搞鬼。

sentences.english: The truth is, no one likes a person who tears others down.
sentences.chinese: 事实是，没有人喜欢一个爱在别人背后搞鬼的人。

sentences.english: Those neighbor boys are always up to no good.
sentences.chinese: 邻居那些男孩总想搞鬼。

sentences.english: When children be do nothing, they are doing mischief.
sentences.chinese: 当孩子们什么事儿也不干的时候，他们是在搞鬼。

sentences.english: The boys whispering in the corner are brewing some mischief.
sentences.chinese: 那些在角落说悄悄话的男孩们正在企图搞鬼。

sentences.english: So I think about it and, aha, figure out it's the refrigerator.
sentences.chinese: 所以我仔细想了想，啊哈，我断定是冰箱在搞鬼。

sentences.english: Don't play games with me, Jane. I'm on to your tricks and manipulations .
sentences.chinese: 简，别跟我搞鬼，我对你的诡计和手段一清二楚。

definition: (coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
undiscovered traitor/enemy within one's own ranks
to play dirty tricks/to be up to mischief
to manipulate from behind the scenes/to pull the strings
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
malign agent who manipulates from behind the scenes/hidden hand
to incite/to prompt (sb to do sth)
